_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Slack Chemical Co., Inc., an ISO 9001 certified company, has utilized its Quality Manual to develop, implement and control policies and procedures of which pertain to the elements described within this plan. This Risk Management Plan (RMP) has been assembled in order to satisfy the requirements set forth within Title 40, Part 68 of the Code of Federal Regulations, Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions. Slack Chemical's stationary source subject to this RMP is located at 21 Grande Blvd, Saratoga Springs, NY 12866 and the regulated substance present in more than a threshold quantity is Chlorine as a liquefied gas stored in 150 pound cylinders and 2,000 pound containers.

The worse-case release scenario is a total release of regulated substance from the largest storage container on-site, that being a 2,000 lb (ton) container. A puncture or breakage of a 150 lb cylinder has been considered as the alternative release scenario. For both scenarios, only passive mitigation measures apply, as the regulated substance is stored inside the facility.

The regulated substance, mentioned above, subject to this RMP is covered by Prevention Program 3. The elements within Program 3 have been satisfied and implemented as described further in the Prevention Program section of this plan.

The Saratoga Springs facility has been handling and storing chlorine cylinders and ton containers for several years and has, to date, not had any incident involving the release of regulated substances from a covered process nor have any possible incidents occurred that may have resulted in a release of regulated substances.

Procedures concerning an emergency response plan or action plan have been created and applied in accordance with OSHA standards. The plan includes specific actions to be taken in response to accidental releases of all chemicals stored on-site. 

As part of the Slack Chemical continuous improvement program, safety is of primary concern and is addressed in a routine manner. At this
time, no changes have been planned or proposed that would improve upon safety measures currently in place.
